extendedIngredients.name: asparagus spears
extendedIngredients.originalString: 12 medium asparagus spears, ends trimmed; cut crosswise in half

extendedIngredients.name: button mushrooms
extendedIngredients.originalString: 12 ounces button mushrooms, wiped clean with a damp towel; halved

extendedIngredients.name: kosher salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: Kosher salt and ground black pepper

extendedIngredients.name: pinot grigio
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons Gallo Family Vineyards Pinot Grigio

recipes.title: Mushroom Duxelles & Asparagus Grilled Cheese #SundaySupper
recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Place garlic, shallots and mushrooms in food processor and pulse until everything is very finely chopped. In medium skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add mushroom mixture; season with salt and pepper. Cook 20 to 22 minutes or until mixture is browned and all moisture is evaporated; stirring frequently. Stir in wine and cream; cook 2 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Meanwhile, place asparagus on rimmed baking pan and lightly spray with cooking spray. Transfer to oven and roast 5 minutes or until just barely tender. Spread 4 slices of bread with mushroom mixture. Divide asparagus and cheese over mushroom mixture; top with remaining bread slices. Lightly spray large nonstick skillet or griddle with cooking spray; place sandwiches in cold skillet. Turn on stove for medium heat. Cook 6 minutes or until toasted; flip sandwiches and cook an additional 4 minutes or until both sides are toasted and cheese is melted.

steps.step: Place garlic, shallots and mushrooms in food processor and pulse until everything is very finely chopped. In medium skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
Add mushroom mixture; season with salt and pepper. Cook 20 to 22 minutes or until mixture is browned and all moisture is evaporated; stirring frequently. Stir in wine and cream; cook 2 minutes.
Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Meanwhile, place asparagus on rimmed baking pan and lightly spray with cooking spray.
Transfer to oven and roast 5 minutes or until just barely tender.

Spread 4 slices of bread with mushroom mixture. Divide asparagus and cheese over mushroom mixture; top with remaining bread slices. Lightly spray large nonstick skillet or griddle with cooking spray; place sandwiches in cold skillet. Turn on stove for medium heat. Cook 6 minutes or until toasted; flip sandwiches and cook an additional 4 minutes or until both sides are toasted and cheese is melted.
